com.pi4j.component.servo

Interface Servo

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Component
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GenericServo

    public interface Servo
extends Component
    Represents characteristics/settings of an R/C-Servo.
    Author:
    Christian Wehrli

        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_END_POINT_LEFT

        static final String PROP_END_POINT_LEFT
        Integer value between 0 and 150.
        0: no travel
        150: max. travel (0.9ms pulse)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_END_POINT_RIGHT

        static final String PROP_END_POINT_RIGHT
        Integer value between 0 and 150.
        0: no travel
        150: max. travel (2.1ms pulse)
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_SUBTRIM

        static final String PROP_SUBTRIM
        Value between -200 and +200

        -200: neutral position changed to 1.3ms
        0: neutral position unchanged at 1.5ms
        200: neutral position changed to 1.7ms

        Endpoints will be adjusted accordingly!

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • PROP_IS_REVERSE

        static final String PROP_IS_REVERSE
        If TRUE servo travelling direction is reversed.

        Note: subtrim and endpoints will not change!

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • setPosition

        void setPosition(float position)
        Sets the servos desired position by providing a percentage value.

        E.g.: a position value of -100 would force the servo to travel to its max. left position as defined in property PROP_END_POINT_LEFT.

        Parameters:
        position - value between -100 and +100 according to POS_MAX_LEFT respectively POS_MAX_RIGHT.

      • getPosition

        float getPosition()
        Returns:
        current position value between -100 and +100[%]

      • getServoDriver

        ServoDriver getServoDriver()
        Returns servo driver this servo is attached to
        Returns:
        servo driver
